00028 #include "qf_pkg.h"
00029 #include "qassert.h"
00030 
00031 Q_DEFINE_THIS_MODULE(qa_defer)
00032 
00033 
00039 /*..........................................................................*/
00040 void QActive_defer(QActive *me, QEQueue *eq, QEvent const *e) {
00041     (void)me;                 /* avoid compiler warning about 'me' not used */
00042     QEQueue_postFIFO(eq, e);
00043 }
00044 /*..........................................................................*/
00045 QEvent const *QActive_recall(QActive *me, QEQueue *eq) {
00046     QEvent const *e = QEQueue_get(eq);  /* get an event from deferred queue */
00047     if (e != (QEvent *)0) {                             /* event available? */
00048         QF_INT_LOCK_KEY_
00049 
00050         QActive_postLIFO(me, e);  /* post it to the front of the AO's queue */
00051 
00052         QF_INT_LOCK_();
00053 
00054         if (e->dynamic_ != (uint8_t)0) {          /* is it a dynamic event? */
00055 
00056             /* after posting to the AO's queue the event must be referenced
00057             * at least twice: once in the deferred event queue (eq->get()
00058             * did NOT decrement the reference counter) and once in the
00059             * AO's event queue.
00060             */
00061             Q_ASSERT((e->dynamic_ & 0x3F) > (uint8_t)1);
00062 
00063             /* we need to decrement the reference counter once, to account
00064             * for removing the event from the deferred event queue.
00065             */
00066             /*lint -e1773                        Attempt to cast away const */
00067             --((QEvent *)e)->dynamic_;   /* decrement the reference counter */
00068                    /* NOTE: cast the 'const' away, which is legitimate because
00069                    * it's a dynamic event
00070                    */
00071         }
00072 
00073         QF_INT_UNLOCK_();
00074 
00075     }
00076     return e;/*pass the recalled event to the caller (NULL if not recalled) */
00077 }
